author: vivek
title: Token Staking Platform
description:
Several reasons that a project may want to distribute tokens:

Raising funds for projectsReward people for engagement, loyaltyNFT utility

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal would be within the challenge goal, and I think that this proposal probably will increase utility & adoption of Cardano NFT and Cardano Smart Contract and built for a great community (developers and consumers). At the same time the statement of how problem is to be solved is explained only on solution matter and in my opinion it doesn’t clear how developers are rewarded when their contracts are used and it doesn’t clear how this proposal can create business value
In my opinion this proposal touch important problem about Cardano smart contract  adoption and important products to improve availability of this kind of services.
I think it's important to improve details about the proposal deliverables for the challenge (eg. business case for adoption, business case for NFT exchange, margin of the services …)
f6_assessments.q1:
There aren’t link in the proposal that refers to peoples to identify the teams the work on the proposal and the proposal assessment is difficult.
I think that the proposal team seams skilled (senior developers Michael Stewart and Vivek Nankissoor) and have a technical knowledge and expertise on the Cardano blockchain and NFT activities and managing.  But the rest of the teams Additional resources will be required to complete this project
The scope of the solution is explained (e.g. how the funds will be spent, what features will be implemented, and so on…).
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics for the assessment is poorly described and KPI seems to describe only project control and not the success of the initiative, so it’s impossible to assess what the proposer wants to do, but the success of his actions is not defined.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem says "Several reasons that a project may want to distribute tokens" but it doesn´t clearly says what is the problem with that. There are no places for token distribution on Cardano? that is a problem. Then the solution talks about features "Indicate  appropriate tokens are staked" that´s not exactly the solution, which in this case would we a platform for solving x and x problem. I would rethink and rewrite the problem and solution summary.
Other from that, the proposal does address the challenge and could have a positive effect on Cardano, but proper problem and solution presentation is key in Catalyst´s proposal. Features seem good and interesting, the proposer thought of challenges and risks and seem able to manage them.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer seem to have experience but do not show evidence about it on the proposal, I would recommend adding LinkedIn links for all members next time. After looking into their website I managed to find some of the team members, but the proposal would benefit if you include it directly, it saves time for the voter and the CA.
The proposal indeed has a very detailed timeline for the project which shows great preparation for the tasks ahead, also the budget fits accordingly
f6_assessments.q2:
Outcome KPIs would greatly improve the proposal, else how will the community be able to audit the process? 
How many projects are you looking to onboard? If promotion only starts after 4 months how will we able to audit before launching?

f6_assessments.q0: The Token Staking Platform aims to address DApps and integration challenge with token staking platform. The platform will configurate staking return rule and calculate reward payout for users. Its goal is to be a utility token platform for projects. They should provide evidence in term of market size in their proposal. It is difficult to know whether this token staking platform will be the most used or most profitable application on the platform. In general their solution satisfies the goal of DApp and Integration quite well. Quality DApps and Integration will increase utility and adoption of Cardano as a result.
f6_assessments.q1: According to their attachment, the project period is 4 months. They have clear plan of what they plan to do in each phase. They should provide some explanation of the plan though as the lists will not be understood by everyone unless they are involved with the project. They detail the budget clearly. It would be helpful if the team can share link so that the community can see if the team has sufficient experience to complete the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The key metric they offer for monitoring their project is to check if they are on time by their schedule and if they could control their budget. However, they do not mention how they will show their project performance to the community. The KPIs should also include key number ie. the count of how many tokens are staked through their platform.The user acceptance test (UAT feedback) is good but it does not show how well received is the project for token staking?  The project progress can be observed but I would like the team to consider their platform traction also for project auditing purpose.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal aims to provide the infrastructure for utility token distribution. Target users would be NFT project creators wishing to reward its audience with fungible / non fungible tokens and for NFT collectors to claim rewards. As far as I know such infrastructure applications are already existent and quite well known. However, in the interest of promoting a free market, the proposal has its own merits and an additional application for token distribution can be valuable for the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The two person team is doing a fair job at presenting themselves and their experience, with many years of software development under their belt as well as being active in the Cardano space for a good number of years. Timewise we are being offered a bullet point style implementation schedule but without clear deadlines or intermediary milestones, which makes me believe that there is a certain lack of structure and organization within the team, especially in terms of planning for future steps. The budget is only broadly described and, for a project asking for such a considerable amount, the level of detail should have definitely been higher. I am indulgently offering four stars but my instinct tells me that I am being a bit too generous.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers offer three KPIs, but very broad and not very meaningful: time completion, budget control and UAT feedback. I would have expected to see at least a promise of an open github repository, perhaps monthly live sessions with the community or other tools to engage the target audience. Considering the indulgence from the previous section, I remain neutral over this one in order to balance personal assumptions.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem is not clearly stated and is left open for assumption. The solution to the problem is also confusing. The proposer needs to be clear in what the current problem is with projects that want to distribute tokens. Regarding the solutions, the proposer needs to explain what he means by “calculating eligibility” and “staking return rules”. 
The team is requesting USD 70,000 which falls in the category of “small teams with proven competences” in the campaign brief of this challenge but from the proposal I do not see how they will aspire to the highest possible levels of certification.  
They have a website showing they have launched a few NFT projects but it is difficult to see how the community can benefit from an initiative when one is unsure what that initiative itself is.
f6_assessments.q1:
The budget is laid out clearly item by item. 

The team has a website and has launched NFTS projects for different artists and are co-founders of the Cardano Canucks stake pool which shows they are involved in the Cardano ecosystem.

The names of the team members are displayed in the proposal and on their website (https://canucks-publishing.com/about-us/). No reference links regarding education and experience were given. The company does have a linkedin page, and I could only find one of the team members on linkedIn.
f6_assessments.q2:
The risks are identified in the proposal but no solutions were given. The proposer needs to lay out probable ways in which the team intends to mitigate or eliminate these risks. 

The solutions the proposer gives to the challenge is not original. In terms of displaying owed rewards and calculating rewards, these are available at : https://www.whenada.com/. Rewarding NFT holders with a fungible token are already being done by some projects themselves. RatsDao(https://ratsdao.io/), Pavia(https://www.pavia.io/) and Cardania(https://cardania.com/) just to name a few. Also more than 80 projects, at list time of writing, make use of https://dripdropz.io/ to distribute their fungible tokens. 

The roadmap and milestone are laid out in a nice Gantt chart(https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gantt_chart). The plan is easy to follow but it is not indicated how will the outcomes be displayed. 

What the team seeks to accomplish it only revealed at the of the proposal under “What does success for this project look like?”. “Success is a completed staking platform/website where projects can be listed and token holders can stake their wallets containing relevant tokens (fungible and non-fungible) for rewards specific to the listed project.” Reward for specific projects are done by the project themselves as they can view all the wallet addresses that own their NFT. That means that you would not need to stake your NFT. Even if you have to stake your NFT, there are projects that will do that on their own like RatsDao.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal meets the challenge requirements of “Novel and viable applications get built of top of Cardano attracting users” by proposing to build a Cardano token staking app that will facilitate such actions as NFT owners airdropping tokens to NFT holders, project fundraising and token holder staking.
f6_assessments.q1:
Two team members are detailed in the proposal.  Both list experience in software development and stake pool operation.  However, neither team member provide experience developing on Cardano.  Therefore, the proposal communicates the need to acquire several additional team members with the necessary Cardano development expertise to complete the proposal.  
No information is provided on who these specialists might be.  No information is provided on any effort/research into short-listing appropriate persons.  Essentially the proposal’s success hinges on acquiring these unspecified Cardano specialists.  At a minimum, investigation into compiling a short-list of Cardano specialists agreeable to the project needs to be communicated in the proposal.   

The proposal mentions the team has created an NFT minting platform, but the website provided only has functionality to send a message to the team.  No details are provided about successfully launched NFT projects through the platform.  It is not possible to confirm degree of the platform’s development or automation by viewing the website provided.  Is the platform’s backend advanced beyond staff manually minting NFT’s based on a client’s criteria list?

The proposal provides a detailed timeline and budget spanning 13 weeks.  Both seem adequate provided the Cardano specialists needed are available.

Given the proposal is highly dependent on as-yet-unknown, unresearched, future key team members, and the track record and complexity of the NFT minting platform (provided as an example of previous development on Cardano) is not communicated, or assessable,  I disagree the proposal is feasible in its current state.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides a clear roadmap with adequate KPI’s of progress.  However, it would be good to see a 2-weekly or monthly report on the progress against the roadmap provided.  Also beneficial would be the inclusion of at least a rough estimation of completion dates (month or quarter-year), as opposed to simply providing a number of total weeks required without an expected commencement or target completion date.  
However, overall I agree the proposal provides sufficient information to assess its progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is lacking in clarity. The problem statement lists out reasons for why projects may want to distribute tokens but the proposal is titled 'Token Staking Platform'. As a reader, I am not sure of what's being proposed. Is it an airdropping service like DripDropz? Or is it a service where users can stake their NFTs(Clay Mates, Spacebudz, DeadPXLz) and earn the projects' respective tokens? Or does it check what NFTs a wallet holds and allows the user to claim tokens?

My guess for what happens: 1) NFT project like Clay Mates wants to distribute tokens so they work with Canucks Publishing. 2) Holder of their NFT connects wallet to claim portal, sees balance available, and claims token. Having a rare NFT, the user gets more tokens than a user with a Common NFT. My question is, why go through this service instead of just airdropping the tokens into the wallet, the way it was done by Pavia, Filthy Rich Horses, and Adaverse?

This proposal would benefit from clearer communication as it is hard to rate the impact of the project without fully understanding what it aims to do.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has great experience working in Cardano. They have worked with Gero Wallet, Charli3, and Canadian Roots Exchange(info found on website.) I have confidence that they can deliver what they set out to do. It's just a little unclear what it is they're actually building. The proposal would benefit from laying it out in layman's terms as I imagine not all readers/voters would be able to understand it(I know I don't).
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal could benefit from 1) quantifiable success metrics, ie. how many projects onboarded. 2) projected timelines(dates) 3) including links to a place where community can track progress

solution:
